| An orc of the ages of stars:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is an [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)").
* is an orc.
* is an [overlord to its kind](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* may [turn against you](/wiki/Treachery "Treachery") when tame. |                                                                       |

An **orc of the ages of stars**, o, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). Orcs of the ages of stars are the strongest type of [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") that can be encountered randomly in those variants, and are far stronger than even [Angband orcs](/wiki/Angband_orc "Angband orc").

An orc of the ages of stars is both [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") as well as [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)"), and can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), is visible via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and will collect [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), jewels and other items. A tame orc of the ages of stars may turn [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor").

An orc of the ages of stars has two weapon attacks and an offhand weapon attack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 As a polyform](#As_a_polyform)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly generated orcs of the ages of stars always appear alongside a [group](/wiki/Group "Group") of 3-12 Angband orcs.

An orc of the ages of stars may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") - their court can contain [deep wyrms](/wiki/Deep_wyrm "Deep wyrm"), [red dragons](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon"), [white dragons](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon"), [black dragons](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon"), [blue dragons](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon"), Angband orcs, [hedrow blademasters](/wiki/Hedrow_blademaster "Hedrow blademaster"), [foocubi](/wiki/Foocubi "Foocubi"), [Olog-hai](/wiki/Olog-hai "Olog-hai"), [siege ogres](/wiki/Siege_ogre "Siege ogre"), and [hell hounds](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound").

## Strategy

While it is possible to not run into one until the [ascension run](/wiki/Ascension_run "Ascension run"), orcs of the ages of stars are easily the most dangerous orcish monsters in the game, and possibly the most dangerous monster to encounter presiding over a throne room.

### As a polyform

The fearsome power of an orc of the ages of stars also makes them a stellar polyform: their 24 speed and ability to [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), combined with their solid base defenses (effectively -5 [AC](/wiki/AC "AC")) and ability to use all medium-sized armor and weapons effectively, make them a highly recommended choice when polymorphing.

## Origin

The orcs of the ages of stars are based on the orcs from [J. R. R. Tolkien](/wiki/J._R._R._Tolkien "J. R. R. Tolkien")'s Middle-Earth setting, and are specifically flavored as survivors from *before* the First Age and the original stock from which all orcs descend.

## Encyclopedia entry

But of those hapless who were snared by Melkor little is known  
of a certainty. \[...] Yet this is held true by the wise of Eressëa:  
that all those of the Quendi that came into the hands of Melkor,  
ere Utumno was broken, were put there in prison, and by slow arts  
of cruelty and wickedness were corrupted and enslaved. Thus  
did Melkor breed the hideous race of the Orkor in envy and mockery  
of the Eldar, of whom they were afterwards the bitterest foes. For  
the Orkor had life and multiplied after the manner of the Children  
of Ilúvatar; and naught that had life of its own, nor the semblance  
thereof, could ever Melkor make since his rebellion in the Ainulindalë  
before the Beginning: so say the wise. And deep in their dark hearts  
the Orkor loathed the Master whom they served in fear, the maker only  
of their misery. This maybe was the vilest deed of Melkor and the most  
hateful to Eru.  
\[ Morgoth's Ring, by J.R.R. Tolkien,  
edited by Christopher Tolkien ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Orc of the ages of stars

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
o orc of the ages of stars (No tile)
Difficulty 36
Attacks Weapon 4d8 physical, Weapon 4d8 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d8 physical
o orc of the ages of stars (No tile)
Difficulty 36
Attacks

Weapon 4d8 physical, Weapon 4d8 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d8 physical

Base level 30
Base experience 1383
Speed 24
Base AC -5
Base MR 45
Alignment -15 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 350
Size medium
Resistances none
Resistances conveyed none

An orc of the ages of stars:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is an elf.
  • is an orc.
  • is an overlord to its kind.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • may turn against you when tame.

An orc of the ages of stars, o, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. Orcs of the ages of stars are the strongest type of orc that can be encountered randomly in those variants, and are far stronger than even Angband orcs.

An orc of the ages of stars is both elven as well as orcish, and can see invisible, is visible via infravision, and will collect gold, jewels and other items. A tame orc of the ages of stars may turn traitor.

An orc of the ages of stars has two weapon attacks and an offhand weapon attack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 As a polyform
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Randomly generated orcs of the ages of stars always appear alongside a group of 3-12 Angband orcs.

An orc of the ages of stars may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated throne room - their court can contain deep wyrms, red dragons, white dragons, black dragons, blue dragons, Angband orcs, hedrow blademasters, foocubi, Olog-hai, siege ogres, and hell hounds.

Strategy

While it is possible to not run into one until the ascension run, orcs of the ages of stars are easily the most dangerous orcish monsters in the game, and possibly the most dangerous monster to encounter presiding over a throne room.

As a polyform

The fearsome power of an orc of the ages of stars also makes them a stellar polyform: their 24 speed and ability to twoweapon, combined with their solid base defenses (effectively -5 AC) and ability to use all medium-sized armor and weapons effectively, make them a highly recommended choice when polymorphing.

Origin

The orcs of the ages of stars are based on the orcs from J. R. R. Tolkien's Middle-Earth setting, and are specifically flavored as survivors from before the First Age and the original stock from which all orcs descend.

Encyclopedia entry

But of those hapless who were snared by Melkor little is known
of a certainty. [...] Yet this is held true by the wise of Eressëa:
that all those of the Quendi that came into the hands of Melkor,
ere Utumno was broken, were put there in prison, and by slow arts
of cruelty and wickedness were corrupted and enslaved. Thus
did Melkor breed the hideous race of the Orkor in envy and mockery
of the Eldar, of whom they were afterwards the bitterest foes. For
the Orkor had life and multiplied after the manner of the Children
of Ilúvatar; and naught that had life of its own, nor the semblance
thereof, could ever Melkor make since his rebellion in the Ainulindalë
before the Beginning: so say the wise. And deep in their dark hearts
the Orkor loathed the Master whom they served in fear, the maker only
of their misery. This maybe was the vilest deed of Melkor and the most
hateful to Eru.
[ Morgoth's Ring, by J.R.R. Tolkien,
edited by Christopher Tolkien ]

An '''orc of the ages of stars''', {{brightmagenta|o}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. Orcs of the ages of stars are the strongest type of [[Orc (monster class)|orc]] that can be encountered randomly in those variants, and are far stronger than even [[Angband orc]]s.

An orc of the ages of stars is both [[Elf (monster attribute)|elven]] as well as [[Orc (monster attribute)|orcish]], and can [[see invisible]], is visible via [[infravision]], and will collect [[gold]], jewels and other items. A tame orc of the ages of stars may turn [[traitor]].

An orc of the ages of stars has two weapon attacks and an offhand weapon attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated orcs of the ages of stars always appear alongside a [[group]] of 3-12 Angband orcs. 

An orc of the ages of stars may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] - their court can contain [[deep wyrm]]s, [[red dragon]]s, [[white dragon]]s, [[black dragon]]s, [[blue dragon]]s, Angband orcs, [[hedrow blademaster]]s, [[foocubi]], [[Olog-hai]], [[siege ogre]]s, and [[hell hound]]s.

==Strategy==
While it is possible to not run into one until the [[ascension run]], orcs of the ages of stars are easily the most dangerous orcish monsters in the game, and possibly the most dangerous monster to encounter presiding over a throne room.

===As a polyform===
The fearsome power of an orc of the ages of stars also makes them a stellar polyform: their 24 speed and ability to [[twoweapon]], combined with their solid base defenses (effectively -5 [[AC]]) and ability to use all medium-sized armor and weapons effectively, make them a highly recommended choice when polymorphing.

==Origin==
The orcs of the ages of stars are based on the orcs from [[J. R. R. Tolkien]]'s Middle-Earth setting, and are specifically flavored as survivors from ''before'' the First Age and the original stock from which all orcs descend.
